spec.scope: Modelling knowledge for thesauri, classification schemes, taxonomies, etc.

info.p: The abbreviation SKOS stands for the Simple Knowledge Organization System and is a specification development within the W3C.

It is a model of knowledge for knowledge organisation systems such as thesauri, classification schemes, taxonomies and other types of structured controlled vocabulary. The main objective of SKOS is to enable easily sharing and linking of controlled structured vocabularies for the semantic web.

titleStmt.title: SKOS Simple Knowledge Organization System: Reference

info.p: The data model of SKOS is defined using an RDF schema
In the describtion of the SKOS data model is used vocabulary taken from OWL.
